Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Description: Primary Create, Read, Update, Delete, Find script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Parameters: TableName ( or TableID ) Method (C, R, U, D, F, V) KeyFieldValue ReadFieldList (return-separated list of human name fields to return) UpdateDict (dictionary of human names and values) SearchRequests (dictionary of find requests)

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Version 1.8 ( LOCKED as of 2012-1-30, 3:30 PM - morgan )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: DISCUSSION:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: 2011-12-08 (shockley): BUG-FIX: the setting of TableID/Name from the other must happen BEFORE you test TableName for blank! 2011-11-18 (shockley): Don't update field if value is the same; primary key search uses "[PrimaryKey]=" instead of "ID="; if no ReadFieldList specified, use [PrimaryKey]. 2011-11-17 (shockley): Bug fixes, testing. 2011-11-16 (shockley): Added in utility window code. 2011-11-10 (phillips): Rolled in F and currently rolling in V 2011-10-27 (phillips): Also a Find (F) method for specifying searches and search criterion to return a dictionary of values 2011-10-21 (shockley): Perhaps we should add one more Method: V, for View? We could then use the script to bring up the requested record(s), ideally in the Main layout for that table. Then, we could htlink-enable a file/table to make it easy for people to send each other links to a specific set of records.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS CONSTANTS

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: These variables are set here for internal programming purposes. Not modified by incoming parameters.

Value.Calculation: "[PrimaryKey]" // The label to use as key in dictionaries where the value will be the key field value.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Set parameters to variables.

Value.Calculation: DictToJSON ( $params ; "" ) // THIS IS SET TO MAKE DEBUGGING EASIER.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Method - The method function being requested. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: TableName - The name of the target table. To be used as an alternative to TableID, since TableID will not break if the table is renamed. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: TableID - The ID of the target table. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ReadFieldList - A carriage-return separated list of human field names to be returned from the script | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: OR a single-item dictionary with the key "ALL" and a value True to indicate reading all available criteria. | Author: shockley Date: 11/17/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UpdateDict - A dictionary of fields and values to be updated | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: SearchRequests - A dictionary of Request Dictionaries, allowing you to perform multiple search requests | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UseFoundSet - Use the current found set instead of performing a find. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UpdateMultiple - Allows the script to perform the update function across multiple records. Needs to be called explicitly to avoid unwanted updates. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: DeleteMultiple - Allows the script to perform the delete function across multiple records. Needs to be called explicitly to avoid unwanted deletes. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ShowDialogs - Will show any dialogs with notifications or errors | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: NoCommit - Will make sure that the record is not committed until the update function runs. Used almost exclusively in the Create function to allow an update to run before the record is updated with required fields to ensure passing record validation. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UseWindowName - A window to use, rather than creating a new utility window. Especially used when Find is being called as a subscript of a parent CRUDFV script. | Author: shockley Date: 11/16/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ViewDict - A dictionary containing all of the options for the resulting view that can be configured. See documentation for full list | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: KeyFieldValue - If the SearchRequests variable contains one key called "[PrimaryKey]" (see $primaryKey_LABEL for the string) in lieu of one or more called "Request", set this variable to that value. | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Top-Level Loop to allow jump to end (Clean-up section):

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Convert any ID parameters into names

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If TableName is not set, grab the table name using the TableID parameter | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If TableID is not set, grab the TableID using the TableName parameter. | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Check for required parameters

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If the TableName or Method parameters are null, exit the script. | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Not all of the necessary parameters were passed. Please contact your database administrator." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Invalid method specified. Please contact your database administrator." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Find the name of the key field for the specified table

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Send a call to COMMONS to get the CRITERION record marked as the key field for the table and return a dictionary. | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Script.name: Get Criteria For Table ( FileName, TableID, HumanNameFieldList, KeyFieldOnly )

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Could not get the Key Field for the table '" & $TableName & "', so the operation could not proceed. ERROR: " & #R( "ResultDescription" ) & "." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: From the result, grab the FieldID for that field | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: If
Step.Calculation:
( $Method = "V" and True ≠ GetAsBoolean( DictGet ( $ViewDict ; "NewWindow" ) ) )
or
not IsEmpty( $UseWindowName )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Only reasons to NOT make a New Window are as follows:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This is a VIEW command, the View params explicitly SAY NewWindow=False, or don't bother to say either way (i.e. default is FALSE for a View),

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: OR UseWindowName IS specified:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Make a new utility window for this search, UNLESS there is a ViewDict with NewWindow NOT specified OR explicitly set to FALSE (default for View is FALSE). Also, do NOT create a window if the one to use was specified.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW NEW WINDOW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: New Window WILL be desired in the View, so put this in the typical spot as default.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Make new window, just allowing defaults for a new window - these may be changed in the VIEW section:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: IF this is JUST going to be used as a hidden utility window, make it small and off-screen:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Find either the blank or the basic layout to perform the functions on.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If a layout was specified in $DestinationLayoutName, it will be navigated to after all processes have been executed | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Go to the layout that matches the string "<<TableName>> Blank" | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If that layout doesn't exist, try "<<TableName>> Basic" | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If that doesn't work, loop over all layouts to find one that is based on the TableName | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Could NOT find a layout for the specified Table, so return ERROR:

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "No layout was found for the specified Table '" & $TableName & "', so the operation could not proceed." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Find Record if method is not C

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If any other method than "C" is called, you're going to need to find the record that is either being Read, Updated or Deleted, so find based on the KeyField and KeyFieldValue | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: a KEY FIELD VALUE was specified, so just use that for the Find:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: We are ALREADY on the specified record (and ONLY it is in found set), so do not run a Find.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If the find didn't run successfully (i.e. an error other than no records found was encountered)

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit without dialog

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; ErrorCode ( Get ( LastError ) ) )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If at least one request dictionary was defined (if SearchRequests used [PrimaryKey], that is handled above).

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Generate the finds | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Loop over all search requests | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Grab the first request dictionary | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Remove the grabbed request from the dictionary of requests | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Loop over each of the criteria in the request | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Do a search in COMMONS for each of the fields contained in the Request dictionary using the keys | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Script.name: Get Criteria For Table ( FileName, TableID, HumanNameFieldList, KeyFieldOnly )

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "The search parameters you specified could not be matched to existing criteria." )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This only jumps out of this sub-loop, not the MAIN loop. So, notice there is a check for Not IsEmpty( $result ) just after this End Loop that jumps out of that, as well.

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Value.Calculation: FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) ; "T" ; "" ; "" ) & "::" & FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "FieldID" ) ; "F" ; "" ; FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) ; "T" ; "" ; "" ) )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Set the fields while in find mode | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit when there are no more fields to be set in the request | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If there is a $result defined, then we should skip to the end of the script - to the Clean-up Section.

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If the find didn't run successfully (i.e. an error other than no records found was encountered)

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit without dialog

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; ErrorCode ( Get ( LastError ) ) )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Check resulting found count

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If no records were found

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit with dialog

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "No records were found." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Explicitly specified to just USE FOUND SET, so do no Find:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: nothing here, as it should be

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: no Search method specified AT ALL = ERROR?

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "No search method of any type was specified." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT CHECK FOUND COUNT

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If no records were found

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit with dialog

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "No records were found." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Else If
Step.Calculation: ( Get ( FoundCount ) > 1 and $Method = "D" and not $DeleteMultiple ) or ( Get( FoundCount ) > 1 and $Method = "U" and not $UpdateMultiple )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If more than one record was found, and we are trying to Delete or Update (without explicitly asking to work on multiple records):

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit with ERROR:

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "More than one record was found." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND FIND

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If we are only performing the F function, exit | Author: phillips Date: 11/9/2011

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Success" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Records were found" ) & # ( "FoundCount" ; Get ( FoundCount ) )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW VIEW

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Set variables from all of the ViewParameterDict Items | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If DestinationLayoutName is not set, grab the layout name using the DestinationLayoutID parameter | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: DISABLED: There WILL already be a new window, unless it was explicitly FALSE, so just use that. | Author: shockley Date: 11/16/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If NewWindow is true (and wasn't already opened by utility script) | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowTitle is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Go to the layout specified | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Exit without dialog

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; ErrorCode ( Get ( LastError ) ) )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If StatusAreaShow is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If StatusAreaHide is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If ResizeToFit is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowAlignTop is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowAlignLeft is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowAlignRight is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowAlignCenter is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If WindowCascade is true | Author: phillips Date: 11/10/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If we are only performing the F function, exit | Author: phillips Date: 11/9/2011

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Success" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Records were found" ) & # ( "FoundCount" ; Get ( FoundCount ) )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE CREATE

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: First, make sure we have no records in found set to start with:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Create the record | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Grab the key field value | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Run this script as an Update to set all fields with any values passed in for the new record | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If Update Params were passed in, run an Update call. If only Read Params were passed in run a Read call. If neither, skip to result. | Author: morgan Date: 1/30/2012

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Error while trying to perform the Update sub-script for this Create command, so the operation could not proceed. ERROR: " & #R( "ResultDescription" ) & "." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE UPDATE

Script.name: Get Criteria For Table ( FileName, TableID, HumanNameFieldList, KeyFieldOnly )

Value.Calculation: # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "Result" ; "Error" ) & # ( "ResultDescription" ; "Could not get the Criteria for the table '" & $TableName & "', so the operation could not proceed. ERROR: " & #R( "ResultDescription" ) & "." )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Now that you have your found set, loop through each one and return either the values specified or all values.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Was ABLE to Open the record for editing:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Loop through all the fields and set them to their corresponding values

Value.Calculation:
FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) & "::" & DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "FieldID" ) ; "T" ; Get ( FileName ) ; "" )
& "::" &
FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) & "::" & DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "FieldID" ) ; "F" ; Get ( FileName ) ; "" )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This field was/is specified via its FieldID, so use that for the dictionary key, rather than the HumanName:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Use HumanName as the dictionary key:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If the current value in the field is not EXACTLY the same as the incoming value, then change it:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: (don't need for Create, since that calls Update)

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ READ

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If a dictionary specifying to read all available criteria was set, note that for use below:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Grab all attributes from a21_COMMONS to return as the script result

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Now that you have one or more records, grab the field dictionary from a21_COMMONS to build your return dictionary

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: IMPORTANT: Script exptects a list (return-delimited) of Human Names to return. If "ALL" = True dictionary is specified, all CRITERIA are returned by the sub-script. If NOTHING is requested, then the [PrimaryKey] value for each record is returned. | Author: shockley Date: 11/18/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If "ALL" = True dictionary is specified, all CRITERIA are returned by the sub-script. | Author: shockley Date: 11/18/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If NOTHING is requested, then the [PrimaryKey] value for each record is returned. | Author: shockley Date: 11/18/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Nothing specified to read, so use [PrimaryKey] :

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: There ARE specified criteria to read, either a list, or the ALL=True:

Script.name: Get Criteria For Table ( FileName, TableID, HumanNameFieldList, KeyFieldOnly )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If an error was encountered, exit the script with the result | Author: phillips Date: 11/14/2011

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // Skip to clean-up section of script.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Grab the item FieldDictList from the resulting Dictionary | Author: phillips Date: 10/26/2011

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Build a new FieldDictList that includes the current field name (or calculation string), rather than evaluating for each record:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: NOT a normal field, so need to store the calc to be used in the loop over the records:

Value.Calculation: FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) ; "T" ; "" ; "" ) & "::" & FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "FieldID" ) ; "F" ; "" ; FM_Name_ID ( DictGet ( $FieldDict ; "TableID" ) ; "T" ; "" ; "" ) )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Now that you have your found set, loop through each one and return either the values specified or all values.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: LOOP OVER RECORDS:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: LOOP OVER RECORDS:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: LOOP OVER RECORDS:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: LOOP OVER RECORDS:

Value.Calculation:
"" /* This will be a list of dictionaries with the requested response lists. It will look like this:
# ( "Email"; "mphillips@nyhtc.org, dshockley@nyhtc.org" ) & # ( "Gender"; "M¶M" )
Note that there is no leading | #( "ResponseLists"; | for this - that will be added when the $result is set.
*/

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Perform Operations

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: If a ReadResponseLists dictionary was passed in, need to build up the ResponseList for each requested:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Loop over fieldDictList_WithFieldNames to find the one for this response:

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: not DictContains ( $fieldDictList_ReadTemp; "FieldDict" ) or IsEmpty( $CriterionKey ) // No point in trying to build this if no CriterionKey specified.

Step.name: If
Step.Calculation: DictGet( $FieldDict; "HumanName" ) = $CriterionKey or ( DictGet( $FieldDict; "UseAlternateKey" ) = 1 and DictGet( $FieldDict; "FieldKey" ) = $CriterionKey ) // alternative key was used (i.e. the Field ID )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This FieldDict includes the Criterion that is needed for this ResponseList:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ERROR? This criterion didn't ask for anything.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This field was/is specified via its FieldID, so use that for the key, rather than the HumanName:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Use HumanName as the key:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Now that we have the value of THIS criterion for THIS record, tack it on to the end of its respective ResponseList using its Delimiter.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: There is no value to add and OmitBlanks was specified for this ResponseList (if not specified, the default is just to add on the BLANK anyway).

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This value is NOT empty, OR OmitBlanks was not specified (default is to add blanks anyway):

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: This value is ALREADY in the list, and the UniqueValuesOnly switch was turned on, so do NOT add to list.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Add this value to the ResponseList and put back into the group of ResponseLists:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: END - each FieldDict being checked for presence in requested ResponseList

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Stop looping over the records if we have either failed or succeeded on each one:

Value.Calculation: # ( "Result" ; "Success" ) & # ( "FileName" ; Get ( FileName ) ) & # ( "ScriptName" ; Get ( ScriptName ) ) & # ( "ResultDescription"; "Deleted " & $deleteCount & " record" & If( $deleteCount = 1; ""; "s" ) & "." ) & # ( "ErrorDicts" ; $ErrorDicts )

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.Calculation: True // NEVER ACTUALLY LOOP - this "loop" was to allow script to jump to end
